name: selvedge
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the edge on a piece of fabric that prevents it from fraying (= forming loose threads): Take the first piece of fabric and fold it in half, selvedge to selvedge. Fabric defect indicators are placed in the selvage by the textile manufacturer.
More examplesFewer examplesSelvedge refers to the clean "self edge" the fabric forms as it's woven on a narrow shuttle loom.Fringes or selvedges that become partially detached can be carefully sewn back by hand.Start at the folded end of the ribbon, and run a gathering stitch along the narrow selvage edge.
